function.name: dlCreateOrGetLock
function.description: Create a new lock with a given name or get it if it already exists. Return the lock handle.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 dlCreateOrGetLock(rstring name, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dlRemoveLock
function.description: Remove lock. Return the true if the lock was there.
function.prototype: public stateful boolean dlRemoveLock(uint64 lock, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dlAcquireLock
function.description: Acquire lock.
function.prototype: public stateful void dlAcquireLock(uint64 lock, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dlAcquireLock
function.description: Acquire lock, with an explicit lease time in seconds.
function.prototype: public stateful void dlAcquireLock(uint64 lock, float64 leaseTime, float64 maxWaitTimeToAcquireLock, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dlReleaseLock
function.description: Release lock.
function.prototype: public stateful void dlReleaseLock(uint64 lock, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dlGetPidForLock
function.description: Get the process id that is currently holding a given lock.
function.prototype: public stateful uint32 dlGetPidForLock(rstring name, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dlGetLastDistributedLockErrorString
function.description: Get the description of the last DB error.
function.prototype: public stateful rstring dlGetLastDistributedLockErrorString()

function.name: dlGetLastDistributedLockErrorCode
function.description: Get the error code of the last DB error.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 dlGetLastDistributedLockErrorCode()

function.name: dpsCreateStore
function.description: Create a new process store with a given name. Return the process store handle if created, 0 otherwise (a process store with the same name exists).
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful uint64 dpsCreateStore(rstring name, T1 key, T2 value, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsCreateOrGetStore
function.description: Create a new process store with a given name or get it if it already exists. Return the process store handle.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful uint64 dpsCreateOrGetStore(rstring name, T1 key, T2 value, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsFindStore
function.description: Find a process store given its name. Return the process store handle if found, 0 otherwise.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 dpsFindStore(rstring name, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsRemoveStore
function.description: Remove a process store given its handle. Return true if the store was there.
function.prototype: public stateful boolean dpsRemoveStore(uint64 store, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsPut
function.description: Put an item into the given store. Returns true if the store did not contain an item with the same key, false otherwise. (A better performing version with no safety checks)
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful boolean dpsPut(uint64 store, T1 key, T2 item, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsPutSafe
function.description: Put an item into the given store. Returns true if the store did not contain an item with the same key, false otherwise. (A version with safety checks that will have performance overhead)
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful boolean dpsPutSafe(uint64 store, T1 key, T2 item, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsPutTTL
function.description: Put an item with a TTL (Time To Live in seconds) value into the global area of the back-end data store. Returns true if the operation is successful, false otherwise.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful boolean dpsPutTTL(T1 key, T2 item, uint32 ttl, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsGet
function.description: Get an item from the given store. Returns true if the store did contain an item with the given key and a matching type, false otherwise. (A better performing version with no safety checks)
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful boolean dpsGet(uint64 store, T1 key, mutable T2 item, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsGetSafe
function.description: Get an item from the given store. Returns true if the store did contain an item with the given key and a matching type, false otherwise. (A version with safety checks that will have performance overhead)
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful boolean dpsGetSafe(uint64 store, T1 key, mutable T2 item, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsGetTTL
function.description: Get an item that was stored with a TTL (Time To Live in seconds) value into the global area of the back-end data store. Returns true if the store did contain an item with the given key and a matching type, false otherwise.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful boolean dpsGetTTL(T1 key, mutable T2 item, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsRemove
function.description: Remove an item from the given store. Returns true if the store did contain an item with the given key, false otherwise.
function.prototype: <any T1> public stateful boolean dpsRemove(uint64 store, T1 key, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsRemoveTTL
function.description: Remove an item that was stored with a TTL (Time To Live in seconds) value into the global area of the back end data store. Returns true if an item with the given key was removed, false otherwise.
function.prototype: <any T1> public stateful boolean dpsRemoveTTL(T1 key, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsHas
function.description: Check if an item exists. Returns true if the given store does contain an item with the given key, false otherwise.
function.prototype: <any T1> public stateful boolean dpsHas(uint64 store, T1 key, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsHasTTL
function.description: Check if an item exists that was store with a TTL (Time To Live in seconds) value. Returns true if an TTL item with the given key exists, false otherwise.
function.prototype: <any T1> public stateful boolean dpsHasTTL(T1 key, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsClear
function.description: Clear the given store.
function.prototype: public stateful void dpsClear(uint64 store, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsSize
function.description: Get the size of the given store.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 dpsSize(uint64 store, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsBeginIteration
function.description: Begin the iteration on a given store. No other operations that can modify the state can be used until after a matching gsEndIteration() call. Returns the iterator.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 dpsBeginIteration(uint64 store, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsGetNext
function.description: Get the next key and value of given types in the given store. Returns true if an item was found, false otherwise.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful boolean dpsGetNext(uint64 store, uint64 iterator, mutable T1 key, mutable T2 value, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsEndIteration
function.description: End the iteration on the given store.
function.prototype: public stateful void dpsEndIteration(uint64 store, uint64 iterator, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsSerialize
function.description: Serialize all the items in the given store.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful void dpsSerialize(uint64 store, mutable blob data, T1 dummyKey, T2 dummyValue, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsDeserialize
function.description: Deserialize the items from the serialized store.
function.prototype: <any T1, any T2> public stateful void dpsDeserialize(uint64 store, blob data, T1 dummyKey, T2 dummyValue, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsGetLastStoreErrorString
function.description: Get the description of the last store error.
function.prototype: public stateful rstring dpsGetLastStoreErrorString()

function.name: dpsGetLastErrorStringTTL
function.description: Get the description of the last error occurred for a TTL data item.
function.prototype: public stateful rstring dpsGetLastErrorStringTTL()

function.name: dpsGetLastStoreErrorCode
function.description: Get the error code of the last store error.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 dpsGetLastStoreErrorCode()

function.name: dpsGetLastErrorCodeTTL
function.description: Get the error code of the last error ocuured for a TTL data item.
function.prototype: public stateful uint64 dpsGetLastErrorCodeTTL()

function.name: dpsGetStoreName
function.description: Get the store name for a given store id.
function.prototype: public stateful rstring dpsGetStoreName(uint64 store)

function.name: dpsGetSplTypeNameForKey
function.description: Get the SPl type name for the key of a given store id.
function.prototype: public stateful rstring dpsGetSplTypeNameForKey(uint64 store)

function.name: dpsGetSplTypeNameForValue
function.description: Get the SPl type name for the value of a given store id.
function.prototype: public stateful rstring dpsGetSplTypeNameForValue(uint64 store)

function.name: dpsGetNoSqlDbProductName
function.description: Get the name of the NoSQL DB product being used.
function.prototype: public stateful rstring dpsGetNoSqlDbProductName()

function.name: dpsGetDetailsAboutThisMachine
function.description: Get the name of the machine and its CPU architecture where this operator is running.
function.prototype: public stateful void dpsGetDetailsAboutThisMachine(mutable rstring machineName, mutable rstring osVersion, mutable rstring cpuArchitecture)

function.name: dpsRunDataStoreCommand
function.description: If users want to execute simple arbitrary back-end data store (fire and forget) native commands, this API can be used. This covers any Redis or Cassandra(CQL) native commands that don't have to fetch and return K/V pairs or return size of the db etc. (Insert and Delete are the more suitable ones here. However, key and value can only have string types.)
function.prototype: public stateful boolean dpsRunDataStoreCommand(rstring cmd, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsRunDataStoreCommand
function.description: If users want to execute arbitrary back-end data store two way native commands, this API can be used. This is a variation of the previous API with overloaded function arguments. As of Nov/2014, this API is supported in the dps toolkit only when Cloudant or HBase NoSQL DB is used as a back-end data store. It covers any Cloudant HTTP/JSON based native commands that can perform both database and document related Cloudant APIs that are very well documented for reference on the web or it covers the HBase related REST APIs.
function.prototype: public stateful boolean dpsRunDataStoreCommand(uint32 cmdType, rstring httpVerb, rstring baseUrl, rstring apiEndpoint, rstring queryParams, rstring jsonRequest, mutable rstring jsonResponse, mutable uint64 err)

function.name: dpsBase64Encode
function.description: Base64 encode a given string. Encoded result will be returned in a user provided mutable string passed as a second function argument.
function.prototype: public stateful void dpsBase64Encode(rstring str, mutable rstring encodedResultStr)

function.name: dpsBase64Decode
function.description: Base64 decode a given string. Decoded result will be returned in a user provided mutable string passed as a second function argument.
function.prototype: public stateful void dpsBase64Decode(rstring str, mutable rstring decodedResultStr)
